definition[0]: a substance containing atoms from two or more elements
example[1]: Sulphur dioxide is a compound of sulphur and oxygen.
definition[1]: a combination of two or more parts, substances, or qualities
example[3]: Teaching is a compound of several different skills.
definition[2]: an area that contains a group of buildings and is surrounded by a fence or wall
definition[3]: a noun, adjective etc that is made up of two or more words. The noun ‘flower shop’ and the adjective ‘self-made’ are compounds.
example[5]: the organic compounds of which living things are made
example[6]: Use a copper compound to protect the trees from pests.
example[7]: toxic compounds such as heavy metals
example[8]: Atoms combine in specific ways to form chemical compounds.
example[9]: This compound contains two atoms of nitrogen and four atoms of hydrogen.
definition[4]: to make a difficult situation worse by adding more problems
example[10]: Helmut’s problems were compounded by his lack of concentration.
definition[5]: to make a bad action worse by doing more bad things
example[11]: He compounded the offence by calling his opponents liars.
definition[6]: to pay interest that is calculated on both the sum of money and the interest
definition[7]: to pay interest on both a sum of money and the interest already earned on it
